      This method checks the front of the priority queue ( the timeout that'll expire soonest, if it finds the timeout has passed then the client is closed, removed from the master and all jobs that are still out for processing and transferred back to the ClusterMaster to attempt sending to another node.

    • Method Detail

      • getClientIP

        public java.net.InetAddress getClientIP()
        Get the IP address of the Client that this Client object is connected to.
        Returns:
        The InetAAddress of the client

      • closeClient

        public void closeClient()
        This method closes the connection to the client and removes it from the associated ClusterMaster so that no more work is allocated. It does not salvage the jobs waiting on returns.

      • getCurrentWork

        public int getCurrentWork()
        Returns:
        The current number of Containers out on this Client

      • getTotalWork

        public long getTotalWork()
        Returns:
        The number of Containers that have been sent out to this Client, since the object was created - the Client itself is not queried.

      • send

        public long send(Container c)
        This method sends the specified container to the Pi, logging it as it does so.
        Parameters:
        c - The container to send
        Returns:
        The unique id of the packet being sent

      • send

        public long send(Container c,
        Callback cb)
        This method sends the specified container to the Pi, logging it as it does so.
        Parameters:
        c - The Container to send
        cb - The callback to be run
        Returns:
        The unique id of the packet being sent

      • broadcast

        public long broadcast(Container c)
        Send the packet to this Client ensuring that it knows that on failure resend should not be attempted
        Parameters:
        c - The container to broadcast
        Returns:
        The id of the broadcast packet

      • broadcast

        public long broadcast(Container c,
             Callback cb)
        Send the packet to this Client ensuring that it knows that on failure resend should not be attempted
        Parameters:
        c - The container to broadcast
        cb - The callback to be run when a response to the container is received from the client.
        Returns:
        The id of the broadcast packet

      • tryFlushQueue

        public void tryFlushQueue()
        This method checks the front of the priority queue ( the timeout that'll expire soonest, if it finds the timeout has passed then the client is closed, removed from the master and all jobs that are still out for processing and transferred back to the ClusterMaster to attempt sending to another node. It's unlikely you'll ever need to call this method as it is automatically run at specified intervals - see source code. Also this method is probably NOT THREAD SAFE As it's automatically run you never know when it might be running so don't call it!
